alternate_of.description: Code of the card that the card is an alternate of. Used for parallel investigators and cards with alternate art.

back_flavor.description: Flavor text on the back of `double_sided` cards. Only use this if the flavor is different from the front.

back_illustrator.description: Illustrator credit on the back of `double_sided` cards. Only use this if the illustrator is different from the front.

back_link.description: Used for double-sided cards where the back is a different card. When this is set, the linked cards need the `hidden` property set to true. In simple cases, the `double_sided` and `back_` attributes should be used.

back_name.description: Name on the back of `double_sided` cards. Only use this if the back name is different from the front.

back_subname.description: Subname on the back of location cards. Use this if the subname is present on the unrevealed side of a location.

back_text.description: Text on the back of `double_sided` cards. Only use this if the back text is different from the front.

back_traits.description: Traits on the back of `double_sided` cards. Only use this if the back traits are different from the front.

bonded_count.description: Number of copies of the card that are bonded to the card referenced in `bonded_to`.

bonded_to.description: Name of the card that the card is bonded to.

clues.description: Number of clues on an act, location or enemy_location. Required to be present for those card types. @see https://github.com/Kamalisk/arkhamdb-json-data/?tab=readme-ov-file#numerical-values

clues_fixed.description: When this is set to true, the `clues` value is fixed rather than scaling with the number of investigators.

code.description: Unique identifier for the card. This is a 5-digit number that is followed by one or two letters. The first letter either marks the backside (b) or a variant of a card (a-x). In case of a variant, the second letter can be (b) to mark the variant's backside.

cost.description: Resource cost of the card. Required for assets and events. @see https://github.com/Kamalisk/arkhamdb-json-data/?tab=readme-ov-file#numerical-values

customization_change.description: List of changes corresponding (by line) to the unlocking of the customization options.

customization_options.description: Array of objects representing the customization options for the card.

customization_text.description: Customization text for the card, where each line corresponds to a customization option.

deck_requirements.description: A comma-separated list of deckbuilding requirements for an investigator. null for investigators that don't have deckbuilding.

deck_options.description: Array of objects encoding deck options for an investigator. null for investigators that don't have deckbuilding.

deck_limit.description: Maximum number of copies of the card that can be included in a deck.

doom.description: Number of doom on an agenda. Required to be present for agendas. @see https://github.com/Kamalisk/arkhamdb-json-data/?tab=readme-ov-file#numerical-values

double_sided.description: Indicates that the card has a back side that can be modeled with the `back_` attributes.

duplicate_of.description: The code of the card that the card is a duplicate of. Used for reprints such as revised core.

encounter_code.description: Code of the encounter set the card belongs to.

encounter_position.description: Position of the card in the encounter set. Use the first value for cards that occupy multiple positions in an encounter set.

errata_date.description: Date of the last errata for the card.

enemy_damage.description: Amount of damage dealt by an enemy. Should be omitted for enemies that don't deal damage.

enemy_horror.description: Amount of horror dealt by an enemy. Should be omitted for enemies that don't deal horror.

exceptional.description: Indicates that the card is exceptional.

exile.description: Indicates that the card can exile.

faction_code.description: Code of the faction the card belongs to.

faction2_code.description: Code of the second faction the card belongs to. Used for multi-class cards.

faction3_code.description: Code of the third faction the card belongs to. Used for multi-class cards.

health.description: Number of health on any card that has health.

health_per_investigator.description: Indicates that the health value is per investigator.

hidden.description: Indicates that the card is hidden. Set for cards that are referenced via a back_link.

illustrator.description: Name of the illustrator of the card.

is_unique.description: Indicates that the card is unique.

myriad.description: Indicates that the card is myriad.

pack_code.description: Code of the pack that the card belongs to.

permanent.description: Indicates that the card is permanent.

position.description: Position of the card in the pack. For several variants of the same card, the position should be the same.

quantity.description: Number of copies of the card in the pack.

restrictions.description: Restricts how the card can be included in a deck. Can be another card, a trait, or a faction.

sanity.description: Number of sanity on any card that has sanity. @see https://github.com/Kamalisk/arkhamdb-json-data/?tab=readme-ov-file#numerical-values

shroud.description: Shroud value of a location. Required to be present for location-like cards. @see https://github.com/Kamalisk/arkhamdb-json-data/?tab=readme-ov-file#numerical-values

side_deck_options.description: Array of objects encoding extra deck options for || Jim. Matches the deck_options schema.

side_deck_requirements.description: A comma-separated list of deckbuilding requirements for || Jim. Matches the deck_requirements schema.

skill_agility.description: Number of agility icons on the card, or agility skill for an investigator. This can take an enum value for investigators. @see https://github.com/Kamalisk/arkhamdb-json-data/?tab=readme-ov-file#numerical-values

skill_combat.description: Number of combat icons on the card, or combat skill for an investigator. This can take an enum value for investigators. @see https://github.com/Kamalisk/arkhamdb-json-data/?tab=readme-ov-file#numerical-values

skill_intellect.description: Number of intellect icons on the card, or intellect skill for an investigator. This can take an enum value for investigators. @see https://github.com/Kamalisk/arkhamdb-json-data/?tab=readme-ov-file#numerical-values

skill_wild.description: Number of wild icons on the card.

skill_willpower.description: Number of willpower icons on the card, or willpower skill for an investigator. This can take an enum value for investigators. @see https://github.com/Kamalisk/arkhamdb-json-data/?tab=readme-ov-file#numerical-values

slot.description: Slot of an asset. Can be omitted for assets that don't occupy a slot. Slots include `"Accessory"`, `"Ally"`, `"Arcane"`, `"Arcane x2"`, `"Body"`, `"Hand"`, `"Hand x2"`. For a card occupying multiple slots, separate slots with a `.`.

stage.description: Stage of the act or agenda. Required to be present for acts.

subtype_code.description: Subtype code of the card. Used to mark weaknesses.

tags.description: Card tags are used to accommodate special deck building rules that are hard to filter for otherwise. A list of available tags can be found in the README.

traits.description: Traits on the card. Traits should include the period.

xp.description: Level of the card. Omit for no level.
